meanings.sent1: I deprecate the use of foul language in our classroom.
meanings.sent2: She deprecates his rude behavior towards others.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to deprecate the students' constant talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent4: His actions deprecate the values we hold dear.
meanings.sent5: The principal's stern look was enough to deprecate any further misbehavior.

meanings.sent1: He tends to deprecate the achievements of others to make himself feel superior.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to deprecate his efforts; she just misunderstood his intentions.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes deprecate his own intelligence for laughs.
meanings.sent4: Her constant criticism seemed to deprecate his self-worth over time.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments only served to deprecate the value of his hard work.

meanings.definition: To urge reasons against; protest against
meanings.sent1: The group will deprecate the new policy during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She deprecates the idea of cutting down the old trees in the park.
meanings.sent3: The children deprecate the early bedtime rule with playful protests.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice was used to deprecate the unfair decision made by the committee.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to deprecate the construction of the noisy factory near their homes.
